author: userinswitzerland
content: Noob question: Is it possible to create an ERC-20 token withouth gas-fee?

author: sky.cactus
content: No, and this isn't really the right place to ask that kind of question.  This server is for research and development of the main Ethereum protocol.  You may want to try Ethereum stack exchange, Reddit, or CryptoDevs Discord server for that class of inquiry.  Alternatively, the answer will reveal itself naturally with additional learning about how gas works and what purpose it serves.  ðŸ™‚

author: marcel1no
content:
*From the yellow paper:*
> 4 Paid for every zero byte of data or code for a transaction

What is meant by zero byte? 0x0? What is the idea behind this?

author: _shemnon
content: One advantage charging less for zero is to not penalize calls that align data on (typically) 256-bit boundaries. Otherwise it becomes economical to engage in opaque encoding schemes.  It still is, just less so.
